lead_paragraph: The suspect, a former employee at the residential care center where 19 people were killed, had expressed extreme views about euthanizing disabled people.

byline.contributor: Motoko Rich reported from Sagamihara, and Jonathan Soble from Tokyo. Hisako Ueno contributed reporting from Sagamihara, and Makiko Inoue from Tokyo.
byline.original: By MOTOKO RICH and JONATHAN SOBLE

headline.print_headline: Knife Attacker Wanted to Rid Japan of the Disabled, Authorities Say
headline.main: Knife Attacker Wanted to Rid Japan of the Disabled, Authorities Say

snippet: The suspect, a former employee at the residential care center where 19 people were killed, had expressed extreme views about euthanizing disabled people....
abstract: Attack by Satoshi Uematsu, who slit throats of sleeping patients at center for disabled people near Tokyo, leaving 19 dead and 26 wounded, is worst mass killing in Japan since World War II; Uematsu had previously expressed view that disabled people should be euthanized and had warned authorities of his plans.
